Title: Donald Trump 'backs two-state solution': Arab-American lobbyist
Description: Following Bishara Bahbah's comments on Sunday, Israel's far-right Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich announced his intentions to annex the West Bank in 2025.

Title: Saudi crown prince demands end to 'Gaza genocide' at Arab summit
Description: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman condemned Israel's actions in Gaza as 'genocide' and called for immediate ceasefires in both Gaza and Lebanon.

Title: Smotrich calls for Israeli annexation of West Bank in 2025
Description: Extremist Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said he hopes the incoming Trump administration in Washington will allow Israel to annex the West Bank

Title: Netanyahu admits ordering Lebanon pager attack
Description: Netanyahu's admission of involvement was followed by the results of an investigation in Taiwan which ruled out involvement in the Lebanon pager explosions

Title: Only $1 mn': Iraqi PM adviser suspected of bribe-taking
Description: Iraq is launching an investigation into a prime ministerial aide over an alleged audio recording, where he suggests a bribe of 1 million dollars is too small.

Title: Israel: Calls for Ben-Gvir to be axed over 'police interference'
Description: Extremist minister Itamar Ben-Gvir is under fire and could face the sack, after his alleged interference in Israel's police force.

Title: Palestinian actress freed after one-year house arrest
Description: Actress Maisa Abd Elhadi was placed under a year-long house arrest by Israeli authorities and barred from accessing social media over posts she made about Gaza.

Title: Israeli strike cuts off Syrian highway linking Damascus and Homs
Description: An Israeli airstrike has cut Syria’s main highway linking the cities of Damascus and Homs, with the official SANA news agency saying an aid centre was targeted.

Title: First Saudi killed 'fighting for Hezbollah' against Israel
Description: Saudi national Omran Karim was killed in an Israeli attack on Lebanon while reportedly fighting with Hezbollah.

Title: First Saudi killed in Lebanon while 'fighting for Hezbollah'
Description: Saudi national Omran Karim was killed in an Israeli attack on Lebanon while reportedly fighting with Hezbollah.

Title: Hezbollah leader, Hariri assassin ‘killed in Israeli strike’
Description: Salim Ayyash, who was convicted in absentia of the 2005 killing of former Lebanese PM Rafic Hariri, has been reportedly killed in an Israeli strike on Syria.

Title: ICC to investigate alleged sexual misconduct by Karim Khan
Description: ICC prosecutor Karim Khan is facing an investigation over alleged misconduct and is under pressure to step aside from his role as the probe is carried out.

Title: UN 'must declare famine' in northern Gaza, Euro-Med says
Description: Northern Gaza, subject to a harrowing offensive and siege, is being deprived of aid and other basics as Israel carries out an ethnic cleansing campaign.

Title: Iranian hackers 'leak details' of Israeli officials on Telegram
Description: The leaks come amid growing concern within Israel after 'Iranian cells' were reportedly spying on military facilities, personnel, and nuclear scientists.

Title: Children among 23 killed in Israeli strike on Lebanon shelter
Description: Israeli airstrikes killed 23 people, including seven children, sheltering in a home near Beirut, as attacks across Lebanon claimed at least 41 lives.

Title: Trump says Haley, Pompeo will not join second administration
Description: Trump thanked Nikki Haley and Mike Pompeo for their service, but said they would not be invited to join his administration when he is inaugurated in January.

Title: UK's Starmer to meet Macron in France to discuss Ukraine support after Trump win
Description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer is in France to discuss support for Ukraine, as Trump's re-election has sparked concerns over reduced US assistance.

Title: COP29 opens after Trump win with call for cooperation
Description: The COP29 climate talks have commenced with Trump's re-election weighing over key discussions including weaning off fossil fuels and helping nations prepare.

Title: Iraqi Kurdistan power-sharing talks might extend until late 2025
Description: Sources indicate cabinet formation in Iraqi Kurdistan may be delayed until after Iraq's 2025 elections, highlighting the region's fragile political balance.

Title: Relentless Israeli strikes kill dozens in Gaza and Lebanon
Description: Palestinians, Lebanese and Syrians are scrambling to bury their dead and find loved ones after overnight Israeli air strikes which have continued into the day.

Title: Relentless Israeli strikes kill 36 in Gaza, 23 in Lebanon
Description: Palestinians, Lebanese and Syrians are scrambling to bury their dead and find loved ones after overnight Israeli air strikes which have continued into the day.

Title: Deadly strikes on Gaza, Lebanon as Israel faces aid deadline
Description: Israel has carried out numerous deadly strikes in Gaza, Lebanon and Syria, killing at least dozens of people and injuring many more.

Title: Egypt hosts 1.2 million Sudanese, with 'hundreds' arriving daily
Description: Hundreds of Sudanese refugees are arriving in Egypt daily, adding to the 1.2 million who have already fled there due to Sudan's civil war.

Title: Afghanistan to attend climate talks, first since Taliban return
Description: Afghanistan ill attend the COP29 climate change conference in Azerbaijan, the first since the takeover of the country by the Taliban.

Title: Turkey arrests journalist over social media post on prosecutors
Description: A Turkish journalist has been arrested for social media posts regarding the investigation of an opposition mayor with supposed links to the outlawed PKK.

Title: Iran says to impose power cuts for lack of fuel
Description: Iran will begin imposing electricity rationing in Tehran and multiple other areas due to a shortage of fuel in the country's power stations.

Title: US set to judge Israel progress on Gaza aid crisis this week
Description: The US will this week make a decision on whether Israel has complied with its demands to improve the humanitarian situation in Gaza.

Title: Turkey: Over 30 charged after protest against mayor removal
Description: The protesters were charged after demonstrating against the removal of three mayors from the Kurdish south-east, after being accused of 'terrorism'.

Title: Netanyahu says he spoke with Trump three times in recent days
Description: The Israeli prime minister also said he had talked to Trump about 'great opportunities before Israel in the field of peace and its expansion'.

Title: Israeli settlers attack Palestinian homes, farmers in West Bank
Description: Israeli settlers and soldiers carried out attacks on Palestinians in the occupied West Bank on Sunday, including against their homes and olive farms.

Title: Sudan: Air strikes kill dozens in Nyala City
Description: Eyewitnesses described a 'horrific massacre' with bodies torn apart as attacks on Nyala City intensify.

Title: Saudi army chief in Iran on rare visit for bilateral talks
Description: Fayyad al-Ruwaili, chief of staff of the Saudi armed forces, met his Iranian counterpart General Mohammad Bagheri for security and bilateral cooperation.

Title: Arab, Muslim leaders head to Riyadh for talks on Gaza, Lebanon
Description: Arab and Muslim leaders will 'discuss the continued Israeli aggression' on the Palestinian territories and Lebanon, as well as current developments.

Title: IAEA chief to arrive in Iran on Wednesday for talks: state media
Description: Grossi will be in Iran next week following an invitation from Tehran, who is determined to revive the nuclear programme agreement.

Title: Netanyahu aides suspected of blackmailing army officer: reports
Description: Members of Benjamin Netanyahu's office are suspected of coaxing an army officer into changing minutes from security meetings ahead of 7 October, reports say.

Title: Netanyahu appoints backer of Israeli settlements as envoy to US
Description: Yechiel Leiter is a resident of an illegal Israeli settlement and frequently campaigns for the expansion of settlements around the occupied West Bank.

Title: Two Saudi military personnel killed in Yemen attack: state media
Description: The Saudi personnel were killed in an attack on a military camp allegedly carried out by affiliates of the Yemeni degfence ministry in Seiyun, Hadhramout.

Title: Israeli strike kills 33, as famine ‘likely happening’ in north
Description: Meanwhile, Israeli strikes also killed journalist siblings Zahra and Ahmed Abu Sakheil along with their father in Gaza City.

Title: Israeli strikes on Syria kill five, mostly pro-Iran fighters
Description: Israeli airstrikes targeted the scientific research centre and warehouses near Safira east of Aleppo and Saraqeb in Idlib, killing five people.

Title: Trump wins in Arizona, completes sweep of all seven swing states
Description: Trump's latest victory in Arizona, in which he obtained 11 electoral votes, completed his sweep of all seven swing states.

Title: Reports on Qatar ending Gaza mediation 'inaccurate': official
Description: Qatar denied reports they are halting mediation efforts and that they are closing Hamas’ office in Doha, urging people to follow official statements.

Title: Israeli strikes kill dozens across Gaza, Lebanon and Syria
Description: Israel's violent strikes have killed scores across the region on Sunday, including over a dozen children.

Title: Israeli strikes kill dozens across Gaza, Lebanon
Description: Israel's siege in northern Gaza and other parts of the territory continued, where at least 30 Palestinians were killed in Jabalia and Gaza City.

Title: Israeli strikes kill 30 Palestinians in Jabalia, Gaza City
Description: Israel's siege in northern Gaza and other parts of the territory continued, where at least 30 Palestinians were killed in Jabalia and Gaza City.

Title: Israeli forces release 20 Palestinian men detained in north Gaza
Description: Palestinian men have been systematically kidnaped and detained in their thousands amid the war in Gaza, subjecting them to several means of violence.

Title: Famine looming in north Gaza: UN-backed report
Description: A UN-backed report has warned that there is an imminent and substantial likelihood of famine occurring in north Gaza due to Israel's siege and assault.

Title: Iran urges Trump to change 'maximum pressure' policy
Description: Iran's vice president has said he hopes Donald Trump adopts polices that lead to openness between the US and Iran, as opposed to 'maximum pressure'.

Title: Star striker Mekhloufi symbol of Algerian struggle dies at 88
Description: Mekhloufi was not just a sporting icon in Algeria, but a figure who became a symbol for Algeria's war of independence against French colonialism.

Title: Maccabi Tel Aviv fans sing racist chants on return to Israel
Description: Maccabi fans continued their racist behavior following the violence in Amsterdam on Thursday, chanting racist slogans upon arrival at Ben-Gurion airport.

Title: UN sanctions 2 generals from Sudan's RSF for key roles in war
Description: The UN Security Council has imposed sanctions on two generals in Sudan's Rapid Support Forces for carrying out ethnically motivated attacks in the country.

Title: Hamas officials deny Qatar has called time on stay in Doha
Description: Three leaders of Hamas spoke to The New Arab's Arabic-language sister site amid reports stating that Doha had urged the group to leave.

Title: Iraqi PM urges Trump to 'work towards ending' Mideast wars
Description: Iraq's prime minister has expressed hope in a phone call with Donald Trump that the president-elect would keep his promises and end the region's wars.

Title: Trump says will 'work to end Gaza war' in call with PA's Abbas
Description: Abbas called Trump to congratulate him on his successful presidential campaign, where they discussed cooperation in working to 'bring peace to the region'.

Title: US announces charges in alleged Iran plot to assassinate Trump
Description: US prosecutors announced charges against an Afghan national for his part in an alleged Iran-backed bid to assassinate US President-elect Donald Trump.

Title: Israel kills dozens in Gaza strikes as famine looms
Description: At least 19 Palestinians, including women and children, have been killed by Israeli strikes in northern Gaza, as hunger experts warm of extreme famine risk.

Title: Paris protesters rally against event hosting Israel's Smotrich
Description: Several hundred protesters gathered in Paris' Trocadero Square to oppose an upcoming gala event hosting Israeli minister Bezalel Smotrich.
